page.title: 01LANDSCAPE AROUND IRCHESTER
page.content:
Our area lies on the southern flanks of the valley of the River Nene,which is pronounced "Nen" locally.It is a gently rolling landscape drained by several small streams flowing northwards into the Nene.
The area straddles the border between Bedfordshire and Northamptonshire.It comprises the village of Wymington in Bedfordshire,the much larger village of Irchester and the western half of the town of Rushden,both of which are in Northamptonshire.Between the settle- ments are large open fields used almost entirely for arable farming.
The main London to Leicester railway line runs through the area and two major roads,the A45 and the A6,pass through the margins of the area.
